categories.name: Organisation of Information Security
categories.description: Plan, implement, maintain and continuously improve the information security framework within the organisation

controls.name: OIS-01
controls.description: The CSP operates an information security management system (ISMS). The scope of the ISMS covers the CSPs organisational units, locations and processes for providing the cloud service.

controls.name: OIS-01.1B
controls.description: The CSP shall establish, implement, maintain and continually improve an information security management system (ISMS), covering at least the operational units, locations and processes for providing the cloud service.

controls.name: OIS-01.2
controls.description: The ISMS shall be in accordance to ISO/IEC 27001

controls.name: OIS-01.3
controls.description: The ISMS shall have a valid certification according to ISO/IEC 27001 or to national schemes based on ISO 27001

controls.name: OIS-01.4
controls.description: The CSP shall document the measures for documenting, implementing, maintaining and continuously improving the ISMS

controls.name: OIS-01.5
controls.description:
The documentation shall include at least:
- Scope of the ISMS (Section 4.3 of ISO/IEC 27001);
- Declaration of applicability (Section 6.1.3), and
- Results of the last management review (Section 9.3).

controls.name: OIS-02
controls.description: Conflicting tasks and responsibilities are separated based on an RM-01 risk assessment to reduce the risk of unauthorised or unintended changes or misuse of cloud customer data processed, stored or transmitted in the cloud service.

controls.name: OIS-02.1
controls.description: The CSP shall perform a risk assessment as defined in RM-01 about the accumulation of responsibilities or tasks on roles or individuals, regarding the provision of the cloud service

controls.name: OIS-02.2
controls.description:
The risk assessment shall cover at least the following areas, insofar as these are applicable to the provision of the cloud service and are in the area of responsibility of the CSP:
- Administration of rights profiles, approval and assignment of access and access authorisations (cf. IAM-01);
- Development, testing and release of changes (cf. DEV-01, CCM-01); and
- Operation of the system components.

controls.name: OIS-02.3
controls.description: The CSP shall implement the mitigating measures defined in the risk assessment, privileging separation of duties, unless impossible for organisational or technical reasons, in which case the measures shall include the monitoring of activities in order to detect unauthorised or unintended changes as well as misuse and the subsequent appropriate actions

controls.name: OIS-02.4
controls.description: The CSP shall automatically monitor the assignment of responsibilities and tasks to ensure that measures related to segregation of duties are enforced.

controls.name: OIS-03
controls.description: The CSP stays informed about current threats and vulnerabilities by maintaining the cooperation and coordination of security-related aspects with relevant authorities and special interest groups. The information flows into the procedures for handling risks (cf. RM-01) and vulnerabilities (cf. OPS-17).

controls.name: OIS-03.1
controls.description: The CSP shall stay informed about current threats and vulnerabilities

controls.name: OIS-03.2
controls.description: The CSP shall maintain contacts with the competent authorities in terms of information security and relevant technical groups to stay informed about current threats and vulnerabilities

controls.name: OIS-03.3
controls.description: The CSP shall maintain regular contact with its CAB and NCCA to stay informed about current threats and vulnerabilities

controls.name: OIS-04
controls.description: Information security is considered in project management, regardless of the nature of the project´.

controls.name: OIS-04.1
controls.description: The CSP shall include information security in the project management of all projects that may affect the service, regardless of the nature of the project

controls.name: OIS-04.2
controls.description: The CSP shall perform a risk assessment according to RM-01 to assess and treat the risks on any project that may affect the provision of the cloud service, regardless of the nature of the project

categories.name: Information Security Policies
categories.description: Provide a global information security policy derived into policies and procedures regarding security requirements and to support business requirements

controls.name: ISP-01
controls.description: The top management of the Cloud Service Provider has adopted an information security policy and communicated it to internal and external employees as well as cloud customers.

controls.name: ISP-01.1
controls.description:
The CSP shall document a global information security policy covering at least the following aspects:
- the importance of information security, based on the requirements of cloud customers in relation to information security, as well as on the need to ensure the security of the information processed and stored by the CSP and the assets that support the services provided
- the security objectives and the desired security level, based on the business goals and tasks of the Cloud Service Provider;
- the commitment of the CSP to implement the security measures required to achieve the established security objectives.
- the most important aspects of the security strategy to achieve the security objectives set; and
- the organisational structure for information security in the ISMS application area.

controls.name: ISP-01.2
controls.description: The CSP’s top management shall approve and endorse the global information security policy

controls.name: ISP-01.3
controls.description: The CSP shall review the global information security policy at least following any significant organizational change susceptible to affect the principles defined in the policy, including the approval and endorsement by top management

controls.name: ISP-01.4
controls.description: The CSP shall review the global information security policy at least annually

controls.name: ISP-01.5
controls.description: The CSP shall communicate and make available the global information security policy to internal and external employees and to cloud service customers

controls.name: ISP-02
controls.description: Policies and procedures are derived from the information security policy, documented according to a uniform structure, communicated and made available to all internal and external employees of the Cloud Service Provider in an appropriate manner.

controls.name: ISP-02.1

metrics.name: RoleDefinitionQ1
metrics.description: Which roles and responsibilities are defined by the security policy?
metrics.category: Organisational Metrics - Security policies and procedures

metrics.name: RoleDefinitionQ2
metrics.description: Which responsibilities are defined for the Cloud Platform Provider?
metrics.category: Organisational Metrics - Security policies and procedures

metrics.name: RoleDefinitionQ3
metrics.description: Which responsibilities are defined for the Cloud Service Provider?
metrics.category: Organisational Metrics - Security policies and procedures

metrics.name: RoleDefinitionQ4
metrics.description: Which responsibilities are defined for the Cloud Service Consumer?
metrics.category: Organisational Metrics - Security policies and procedures

controls.name: ISP-02.2
controls.description: The policies and procedures shall include staff qualification requirements and the establishment of substitution rules in their description of roles and responsibilities within the organization

controls.name: ISP-02.3
controls.description: The CSP shall communicate and make available the policies and procedures to all internal and external employees

controls.name: ISP-02.4
controls.description: The CSP’s top management shall approve the security policies and procedures or delegate this responsibility to authorized bodies

controls.name: ISP-02.5
controls.description: In case of a delegation, the authorized bodies shall report at least annually to the top management on the security policies and their implementation

controls.name: ISP-02.6
controls.description: The CSP’s subject matter experts shall review the policies and procedures for adequacy at least annually, when the global information security policy is updated, and when major changes may affect the security of the cloud service

controls.name: ISP-02.7
controls.description: After an update of procedures and policies, they shall be approved before they become effective, and then communicated and made available to internal and external employees

controls.name: ISP-03
controls.description: Exceptions to the policies and procedures for information security as well as respective controls are explicitly listed.

controls.name: ISP-03.1
controls.description: The CSP shall maintain a list of exceptions to the security policies and procedures, including associated controls.

controls.name: ISP-03.2
controls.description: The exceptions are limited in time

controls.name: ISP-03.3
controls.description: The exceptions shall be subjected to the RM-01 risk management process, including approval of these exceptions and acceptance of the associated risks by the risk owners

controls.name: ISP-03.4
controls.description: The exceptions to a security policy or procedure shall be approved by the top management or authorized body who approved the security policy or procedure

controls.name: ISP-03.5
controls.description: The list of exceptions shall be reviewed at least annually

controls.name: ISP-03.6
controls.description: The approvals of the list of exceptions shall be reiterated at least annually, even if the list has not been updated

controls.name: ISP-03.7
controls.description: The list of exceptions shall be automatically monitored to ensure that the validity of approved exceptions has not expired and that all reviews and approvals are up-to-date

categories.name: Risk Management
categories.description: Provide a global information security policy, derived into policies and procedures regarding security requirements and to support business requirements

controls.name: RM-01
controls.description: Risk management policies and procedures are documented and communicated to stakeholders

controls.name: RM-01.1
RM-01.2
controls.description: The CSP shall use a documented risk analysis method that guarantees reproducibility and comparability of the approach

controls.name: RM-02
controls.description: Risk assessment-related policies and procedures are implemented on the entire perimeter of the cloud service

controls.name: RM-02.1
controls.description: The CSP shall implement the policies and procedures covering risk assessment on the entire perimeter of the cloud service.

controls.name: RM-02.2
controls.description: The CSP shall make the results of the risk assessment available to relevant stakeholders

controls.name: RM-02.3
controls.description: The CSP shall review and revise the risk assessment at least annually, and after each major change that may affect the security of the cloud service.

controls.name: RM-02.4
controls.description: The CSP shall monitor the evolution of the risk factors and revise the risk assessment results accordingly

controls.name: RM-03
controls.description: Identified risks are prioritized according to their criticality and treated according to the risk policies and procedures by reducing or avoiding them through security controls, by sharing them, or by retaining them. Residual risks are accepted by the risk owners

controls.name: RM-03.1
controls.description: The CSP shall prioritize risks according to their criticality

controls.name: RM-03.2
controls.description: The CSP shall define and implement a plan to treat risks according to their priority level by reducing or avoiding them through security controls, by sharing them, or by retaining them.

controls.name: RM-03.3
controls.description: The risk treatment plan shall reduce the risk level to a threshold that the risk owners deem acceptable (Residual Risk).

controls.name: RM-03.4
controls.description: The risk owners shall formally approve the treatment plan and in particular accept the residual risk

controls.name: RM-03.5
controls.description: The CSP shall make the risk treatment plan available to relevant stakeholders

controls.name: RM-03.6
controls.description: If the CSP shares risks with the CSC, the shared risks shall be associated to Complementary Customer Controls (CCCs) and described in the user documentation

controls.name: RM-03.7
controls.description: The CSP shall revise the risk treatment plan every time the risk assessment is revised.

controls.name: RM-03.8
controls.description: The risk owners shall review for adequacy the analysis, evaluation and treatment of risks, including the approval of actions and acceptance of residual risks, after each revision of the risk assessment and treatment plans.

categories.name: Human Resources
categories.description: Ensure that employees understand their responsibilities, are aware of their responsibilities with regard to information security, and that the organisation´s assets are protected in the event of changes in responsibilities or termination.

controls.name: HR-01
controls.description: The policies applicable to the management of internal and external employees include provisions that cover a risk classification of all information security-sensitive positions, a code of ethics, and a disciplinary procedure that applies to all of the employees involved in supplying the service who have breached the security policy.

controls.name: HR-01.1
controls.description: The CSP shall classify information security-sensitive positions according to their level of risk, including positions related to IT administration and to the provisioning of the cloud service in the production environment, and all positions with access to cloud customer data or system components.

controls.name: HR-01.2
controls.description: The CSP shall include in its employment contracts or on a dedicated code of conduct or ethics an overarching agreement from internal and external employees to act ethically in their professional duties.

controls.name: HR-01.3
controls.description:
The CSP shall document, communicate and implement a policy that describes actions to take in the event of violations of policies and instructions or applicable legal and regulatory requirements, including at least the following aspects:
- Verifying whether a violation has occurred; and
- Consideration of the nature and severity of the violation and its impact

controls.name: HR-01.4
controls.description: If disciplinary measures are defined in the policy mentioned in HR-01.3, then the internal and external employees of the CSP shall be informed about possible disciplinary measures and the use of these disciplinary measures shall be appropriately documented.

controls.name: HR-02
controls.description: The competency and integrity of all internal and external employees in a position classified in objective HR-01 are verified prior to commencement of employment in accordance with local legislation and regulation by the CSP.

controls.name: HR-02.1
controls.description: The competency and integrity of all internal and external employees of the CSP with access to cloud customer data or system components under the CSP’s responsibility, or who are responsible to provide the cloud service in the production environment shall be reviewed before commencement of employment in a position classified in objective HR-01. The extent of the review shall be proportional to the business context, the sensitivity of the information that will be accessed by the employee, and the associated risks.

controls.name: HR-02.2
controls.description: The competency and integrity of internal and external employees of the CSP shall be reviewed before commencement of employment in a position with a higher risk classification that their previous position

controls.name: HR-02.3
controls.description: The competency and integrity of internal and external employees of the CSP shall be reviewed annually for the employees in positions with the highest levels of risk classification, starting at a level to be defined in the human resource policy

controls.name: HR-03
controls.description: The CSP's internal and external employees are required by the employment terms and conditions to comply with applicable policies and instructions relating to information security, and to the CSP’s code of ethics, before being granted access to any cloud customer data or system components under the responsibility of the CSP used to provide the cloud service in the production environment.

controls.name: HR-03.1
controls.description: The CSP shall ensure that all internal and external employees are required by their employment terms and conditions to comply with all applicable information security policies and procedures

controls.name: HR-03.2
controls.description: The CSP shall ensure that the employment terms for all internal and external employees include a non-disclosure provision, which shall cover any information that has been obtained or generated as part of the cloud service, even if anonymised and decontextualized.

controls.name: HR-03.3
controls.description: The CSP shall give a presentation of all applicable information security policies and procedures to internal and external employees before granting them any access to customer data, the production environment, or any component thereof

controls.name: HR-03.4
controls.description: All internal and external employees shall acknowledge in a documented form the information security policies and procedures presented to them before they are granted any access to customer data, the production environment, or any component thereof

controls.name: HR-03.5
controls.description: The verification of the acknowledgement defined in HR-03.4 shall be automatically monitored in the processes and automated systems used to grant access rights to employees.

metrics.name: TransportEncryptionEnabled
metrics.description: This metric is used to assess if the cloud service/asset accepts encrypted connections
metrics.category: Technical Metrics - Cryptography and key management

metrics.name: TransportEncryptionEnforced
metrics.description: This metric is used to assess if the cloud service/asset enforces encrypted connections
metrics.category: Technical Metrics - Cryptography and key management

controls.name: HR-04
controls.description: The CSP operates a target group-oriented security awareness and training program, which is completed by all internal and external employees of the CSP on a regular basis.

controls.name: HR-04.1
HR-04.2
controls.description: The CSP shall define an awareness and training program on a target group-oriented manner, taking into consideration at least the position’s risk classification and technical duties

controls.name: HR-04.3
controls.description: The CSP shall review their security awareness and training program based on changes to policies and instructions and the current threat situation

controls.name: HR-04.4
controls.description: The CSP shall update their security awareness and training program at least annually

controls.name: HR-04.5
controls.description: The CSP shall ensure that all employees complete the security awareness and training program defined for them

controls.name: HR-04.6
controls.description: The CSP shall ensure that all employees complete the security awareness and training program on a regular basis, and when changing target group

controls.name: HR-04.7
controls.description: The CSP shall automatically monitor the completion of the security awareness and training program

controls.name: HR-04.8
controls.description: The CSP shall measure and evaluate the learning outcomes achieved through the awareness and training programme

controls.name: HR-04.9
controls.description: The CSP shall measure and evaluate in a target group-oriented manner the learning outcomes achieved through the awareness and training programme. The measurements shall cover quantitative and qualitative aspects, and the results shall be used to improve the awareness and training programme.

controls.name: HR-04.10
controls.description: The CSP shall verify the effectiveness of the security awareness and training program using practical exercises in security awareness training that simulate actual cyber-attacks

controls.name: HR-05
controls.description:
Internal and external employees have been informed about which responsibilities, arising from the guidelines and instructions relating to information security, will remain in place when their employment is terminated or changed and for how long.
 
Upon termination or change in employment, all the access rights of the employee are revoked or appropriately modified, and all accounts and assets are processed appropriately.

controls.name: HR-05.1
controls.description: The CSP shall communicate to internal and external employees their ongoing responsibilities relating to information security when their employment is terminated or changed.

controls.name: HR-05.2
controls.description: The CSP shall apply a specific procedure to revoke the access rights and process appropriately the accounts and assets of internal and external employees when their employment is terminated or changed

controls.name: HR-05.3
controls.description: The procedure mentioned in HR-05.2 shall define specific roles and responsibilities and include a documented checklist of all required steps

controls.name: HR-05.4
controls.description: The CSP shall automatically monitor the application of the procedure mentioned in HR-05.2

controls.name: HR-06
controls.description: Non-disclosure or confidentiality agreements are in place with internal employees, external service providers and suppliers of the CSP to protect the confidentiality of the information exchanged between them.

controls.name: HR-06.1
controls.description: The CSP shall ensure that non-disclosure or confidentiality agreements are agreed with internal employees, external service providers and suppliers

controls.name: HR-06.2
controls.description: The non-disclosure or confidentiality agreements shall be based on the requirements identified by the CSP for the protection of confidential information and operational details

controls.name: HR-06.3
controls.description: The agreements shall be accepted by external service providers and suppliers when the contract is agreed

controls.name: HR-06.4
controls.description: The agreements shall be accepted by internal employees of the CSP before authorisation to access data of cloud customers is granted

controls.name: HR-06.5
controls.description: The requirements on which the agreements are based shall be documented and reviewed at regular intervals, at least annually; if the review shows that the requirements need to be adapted, the non-disclosure or confidentiality agreements shall be updated accordingly.

controls.name: HR-06.6
controls.description: The CSP shall inform its internal employees, external service providers and suppliers and obtain confirmation of the updated confidentiality or non-disclosure agreement.

controls.name: HR-06.7
controls.description: The CSP shall automatically monitor the confirmation of non-disclosure or confidentiality agreements by internal employees, external service providers and suppliers

categories.name: Asset Management
categories.description: Identify the organisation´s own assets and ensure an appropriate level of protection throughout their lifecycle

controls.name: AM-01
controls.description: The Cloud Service Provider has established procedures for inventorying assets, including all IT to ensure complete, accurate, valid and consistent inventory throughout the asset lifecycle.

controls.name: AM-01.1
controls.description: The CSP shall document and implement policies and procedures for maintaining an inventory of assets

metrics.name: AssetManagementPolicy01
metrics.description: Which asset management policy is defined?

metrics.name: AssetManagementPolicy02
metrics.description: Which physical asset inventory policy is defined?

metrics.name: AssetManagementPolicy03
metrics.description: Which asset information is kept in the inventory?

controls.name: AM-01.2
controls.description: The inventory shall be performed automatically and/or by the people or teams responsible for the assets to ensure complete, accurate, valid and consistent inventory throughout the asset life cycle

controls.name: AM-01.3
controls.description: The CSP shall record for each asset the information needed to apply the risk management procedure defined in RM-01.

controls.name: AM-01.4
controls.description: The information recorded with assets shall include the measures taken to manage the risks associated to the asset through its life cycle

controls.name: AM-01.5
controls.description: The information about assets shall be considered by monitoring applications to identify the impact on cloud services and functions in case of events that could lead to a breach of protection objectives, and to support information provided to affected cloud customers in accordance with contractual agreements

controls.name: AM-01.6
controls.description: The CSP shall automatically monitor the inventory of assets to guarantee it is up-to-date

controls.name: AM-02
controls.description: Policies and procedures for acceptable use and safe handling of assets are documented, communicated and provided in accordance with SP-01, including in particular customer-owned assets and removable media.

controls.name: AM-02.1
controls.description: The CSP shall document, communicate and implement policies and procedures for acceptable use and safe handling of assets (reference to ISP-01)

controls.name: AM-02.2
controls.description: The policies and procedures for acceptable use and safe handling of assets shall address at least the following aspects of the asset lifecycle as applicable to the asset (reference to ISP-01) [list in the guidance]Substantial

controls.name: AM-02.3
controls.description: When removable media is used in the technical infrastructure or for IT administration tasks, this media shall be dedicated to a single use

controls.name: AM-03
controls.description: The Cloud Service Provider has an approval procedure for the use of hardware to be commissioned or decommissioned, which is used to provide the cloud service in the production environment, depending on its intended use and based on the applicable policies and procedures.

controls.name: AM-03.1
controls.description: The CSP shall document, communicate and implement a procedure for the commissioning of hardware that is used to provide the cloud service in the production environment, based on applicable policies and procedures

controls.name: AM-03.2
controls.description: The procedure mentioned in AM-03.1 shall ensure that the risks arising from the commissioning are identified, analysed and mitigated.

controls.name: AM-03.3
controls.description: The procedure mentioned in AM-03.1 shall include verification of the secure configuration of the mechanisms for error handling, logging, encryption, authentication and authorisation according to the intended use and based on the applicable policies, before authorization to commission the asset can be granted.

controls.name: AM-03.4
controls.description: The CSP shall document, communicate and implement a procedure for the decommissioning of hardware that is used to provide the cloud service in the production environment, requiring approval based on applicable policies.

controls.name: AM-03.5
controls.description: The procedure mentioned in AM.03-4 shall include the complete and permanent deletion of the data or the proper destruction of the media.

controls.name: AM-03.6
controls.description: The approval of the commissioning and decommissioning of hardware shall be digitally documented and automatically monitored.

controls.name: AM-04
controls.description:
The Cloud Service Provider's internal and external employees are provably committed to the policies and instructions for acceptable use and safe handling of assets before they can be used if the Cloud Service Provider has determined in a risk assessment that loss or unauthorised access could compromise the information security of the Cloud Service.

Any assets handed over are returned upon termination of employment.

controls.name: AM-04.1
controls.description: The CSP shall ensure and document that all internal and external employees are committed to the policies and procedures for acceptable use and safe handling of assets in the situations described in AM-03

controls.name: AM-04.2
controls.description: The procedure mentioned in HR-06.2 shall include steps to ensure that all assets under custody of an employee are returned upon termination of employment.

controls.name: AM-04.3
controls.description: The CSP shall centrally manage the assets under the custody of internal and external employees, including at least software, data, and policy distribution, as well as remote deactivation, deletion or locking, as available on the asset.

controls.name: AM-04.4
controls.description: The verification of the commitment defined in AM-04.1 shall be automatically monitored

controls.name: AM-05
controls.description: Assets are classified and, if possible, labelled. Classification and labelling of an asset reflect the protection needs of the information it processes, stores, or transmits.

controls.name: AM-05.1
controls.description: The CSP shall define an asset classification schema that reflects for each asset the protection needs of the information it processes, stores, or transmits

controls.name: AM-05.2
controls.description: The asset classification schema shall provide levels of protection for the confidentiality, integrity, availability, and authenticity protection objectives

controls.name: AM-05.3
controls.description: When applicable, the CSP shall label all assets according to their classification in the asset classification schema

controls.name: AM-05.4
controls.description: The need for protection shall be determined by the individuals or groups responsible for the assets

categories.name: Physical Security
categories.description: Prevent unauthorised physical access and protect against theft, damage, loss and outage of operations

controls.name: PS-01
controls.description: The buildings and premises related to the cloud service provided are divided into zones by security perimeters, depending on the level on information security risk associated to the activities performed and assets stored in these buildings and premises.

controls.name: PS-01.1
controls.description: The CSP shall define security perimeters in the buildings and premises related to the cloud service provided

controls.name: PS-01.2
controls.description: The CSP shall define at least two security areas, with one covering all buildings and premises and one covering sensitive activities such as the buildings and premises hosting the information system for the production of the service

controls.name: PS-01.3
controls.description: The CSP shall define at least an additional private area that may host development activities and administration, supervision and operation workstations

controls.name: PS-01.4
controls.description: The CSP shall ensure that no direct access exists between a public area and a sensitive area

controls.name: PS-01.5
controls.description: The CSP shall ensure that all delivery, loading areas, and other points through which unauthorised persons can penetrate into the premises without being accompanied are part of the public area

controls.name: PS-01.6
controls.description: The CSP shall define and communicate a set of security requirements for each security area in a policy according to SP-02

controls.name: PS-01.7
controls.description: The security requirements in PS-01.5 shall be based on the security objectives of the information security policy, identified protection requirements for the cloud service and the assessment of risks to physical and environmental security

controls.name: PS-02
controls.description: Physical access through the security perimeters are subject to access control measures that match each zone’s security requirements and that are supported by an access control system.

controls.name: PS-02.1
controls.description: The CSP shall document, communicate and implement policies and procedures related to the physical access control to the security areas matching the requirements defined in PS-01 and based on the principles defined in IAM-01

controls.name: PS-02.2
controls.description: The access control policy shall require at least one authentication factor for accessing any non-public area

controls.name: PS-02.3
controls.description: The access control policy shall require at least two authentication factors are used for access to sensitive areas and to areas hosting system components that process cloud customer data

controls.name: PS-02.4
controls.description: The access control policy shall include measures to individually track visitors and third-party personnel during their work in the premises and buildings, identified as such and supervised during their stay

controls.name: PS-02.5
controls.description: The access control policy shall describe the physical access control derogations in case of emergency

controls.name: PS-02.6
controls.description: The access control policy shall describe the time slots and conditions for accessing each area according to the profiles of the users

controls.name: PS-02.7
controls.description: The CSP shall display at the entrance of all non-public perimeters a warning concerning the limits and access conditions to these perimeters

controls.name: PS-02.8
controls.description: The CSP shall protect security perimeters with security measures to detect and prevent unauthorised access in a timely manner so that it does not compromise the information security of the cloud service

controls.name: PS-02.9
controls.description: The access control policy shall include logging of all accesses to non-public areas that enables the CSP to check whether only defined personnel have entered these zones

controls.name: PS-02.10
controls.description: The logging of accesses shall be automatically monitored to guarantee fulfilment of PS-02.9

controls.name: PS-03
controls.description: There are specific rules regarding work in non-public areas, to be applied by all internal and external employees who have access to these areas.

controls.name: PS-03.1
controls.description: The CSP shall document, communicate, and implement policies and procedures concerning work in non-public areas

controls.name: PS-03.2
controls.description: The policies and procedures in PS-02.1 shall include a clear screen policy and a clear desk policy for documents and removable media

controls.name: PS-03.3
controls.description: The CSP shall define a mapping between activities and zones that indicates which activities may/shall not/shall be performed in every security area

controls.name: PS-03.4
controls.description: The CSP shall define a mapping between assets and zones that indicates which assets may/shall not/shall be used in every security area

controls.name: PS-04
controls.description: The equipment used in the Cloud Service Provider’s premises and buildings are protected physically against damage and unauthorized access by specific measures.

controls.name: PS-04.1
PS-04.2
controls.description: The procedures defined in PS-04.1 shall include a procedure to check the protection of power and communications cabling, to be performed regularly, at least every two years, as well as in case of suspected manipulation by qualified personnel

controls.name: PS-04.3
controls.description: The policies and procedures in PS-04.1 shall include a procedure for transferring any equipment containing customer data off-site for disposal that guarantees that the level of protection in terms of confidentiality and integrity of the assets during their transport is equivalent to that on the site

controls.name: PS-04.4
controls.description: The procedure mentioned in PS-04.3 shall include a formal validation by top management of the CSP or by the authorized body that validated this procedure

controls.name: PS-04.4a
controls.description: The CSP shall establish a wiring scheme and keep it up-to-date

controls.name: PS-04.5
controls.description: The CSP shall ensure that the maintenance agreements for equipment used to host the cloud service make it possible to have security updates installed timely on this equipment

controls.name: PS-04.6
controls.description: The policies and procedures in PS-04.1 shall include measures to ensure that the conditions for installation, maintenance and servicing of the related technical equipment (e.g., electrical power, air conditioning, fire protection) are compatible with the cloud service’s availability and security requirements

controls.name: PS-04.7
controls.description: The CSP shall ensure that an equipment containing a media with customer data can be returned to a third party only if the customer data stored on it is encrypted in accordance with CKM-03 or has been destroyed beforehand using a secure deletion mechanism

controls.name: PS-04.8
controls.description: The CSP shall use encryption on the removable media and the backup media intended to move between security areas according to the sensitivity of the data stored on the media

controls.name: PS-05
controls.description: The premises from which the cloud service operated, and in particular its data centres, are protected against external and environmental threats.

controls.name: PS-05.1
PS-05.2
controls.description: The security requirements defined in PS-05.1 for datacentres shall be based on criteria which comply with established rules of technology

controls.name: PS-05.3

categories.name: Communication Security
categories.description: Ensure the protection of information in networks and the corresponding information processing systems

controls.description: The CSP has implemented appropriate technical safeguards in order to detect and respond to network based attacks as well as to ensure the protection of information and information processing systems

controls.name: CS-01.1
controls.description: The CSP shall document, communicate and implement technical safeguards that are suitable to promptly detect and respond to network-based attacks and to ensure the protection of information and information processing systems, in accordance with ISP-02

metrics.name: NetworkSecurityPolicy01
metrics.description: Which network-level attacks are mitigated by the implemented mechanisms?

controls.name: CS-01.2
controls.description: The technical safeguards in CS-01.1 shall be based on the results of a risk analysis carried out according to RM-01.

controls.name: CS-01.3
controls.description: The CSP shall feed into a SIEM (Security Information and Event Management) system, all data from the technical safeguards implemented so that automatic countermeasures regarding correlating events are initiated

controls.name: CS-01.4
controls.description: The CSP shall implement technical safeguards to ensure that no unknown (physical or virtual) devices join its (physical or virtual) network

controls.name: CS-01.5
controls.description: The CSP shall use different technologies on its technical safeguards to prevent that a single vulnerability leads to the simultaneous breach of several defence lines

controls.name: CS-02
controls.description: The establishment of connections within the CSP’s network is subject to specific security requirements.

controls.name: CS-02.1

metrics.name: NetworkAccessPolicy01
metrics.description: Which security mechanism protecs access to administrative networks?

controls.name: CS-03
controls.description: The communication flows within the cloud, internal and external, are monitored according to the regulations to respond appropriately and timely to threats

controls.name: CS-03.1
controls.description: The CSP shall distinguish between trusted and untrusted networks, based on a risk assessment

metrics.name: TrustedNetworkPolicy01
metrics.description: Which process exists for determining the trustworthiness of network connections?

controls.name: CS-03.2
controls.description: The CSP shall separate trusted and untrusted networks into different security zones for internal and external network areas (and DMZ, if applicable)

controls.name: CS-03.3
controls.description: The CSP shall design and configure both physical and virtualized network environments to restrict and monitor the connection to trusted or untrusted networks according to the defined security requirements (cf. CS-02)

controls.name: CS-03.4
controls.description: The CSP shall review at specified intervals the business justification for using all services, protocols, and ports. This review shall also include the compensatory measures used for protocols that are considered insecure

controls.name: CS-03.5
controls.description: The CSP shall review at least annually the design and implementation and configuration undertaken to monitor the connections in a risk-oriented manner, with regard to the defined security requirements

controls.name: CS-03.6
controls.description: The CSP shall assess the risks of identified vulnerabilities in accordance with the risk management procedure (cf. RM-01) and follow-up measures shall be defined and tracked (cf.OPS-17)

controls.name: CS-03.7
controls.description: The CSP shall protect all SIEM logs to avoid tampering

controls.name: CS-04
controls.description: Cross-network access is restricted and only authorised based on specific security assessments.

controls.name: CS-04.1
controls.description: Each network perimeter shall be controlled by security gateways

controls.name: CS-04.2
controls.description: Security gateways shall only allow legitimate connections identified in a matrix of authorized flows

controls.name: CS-04.3
controls.description: The system access authorisation for cross-network access shall be based on a security assessment based on the requirements of the cloud customers.

controls.name: CS-04.4
controls.description: Each network perimeter shall be controlled by redundant and highly available security gateways

controls.name: CS-04.5
controls.description: The CSP shall automatically monitor the control of the network perimeters to guarantee fulfilment of CS-04.1

controls.name: CS-05
controls.description: Administrative and operational management duties are performed on networks segregated from other networks to prevent unauthorized traffics and to maintain separation of duties.

controls.name: CS-05.1
controls.description: The CSP shall define and implement separate networks for the administrative management of the infrastructure and the operation of management consoles

metrics.name: TrafficSegregationPolicy01
metrics.description: Which traffic segreation policy is defined?

controls.name: CS-05.2
controls.description: The CSP shall logically or physically separate the networks for administration from the CSCs’ networks

controls.name: CS-05.3
controls.description: The CSP shall segregate physically or logically the networks used to migrate or create virtual machines

controls.name: CS-05.4
controls.description: When the administration networks are not physically segregated from other networks, the administration flows must be conveyed in a strongly encrypted tunnel.

controls.name: CS-05.5
controls.description: The CSP shall set up and configure an application firewall in order to protect the administration interfaces intended for CSCs and exposed over a public network

controls.name: CS-06
controls.description: Administrative and operational management duties are performed on networks segregated from other networks to prevent unauthorized traffics and to maintain separation of duties.

controls.name: CS-06.1
controls.description: The CSP shall define, document and implement segregation mechanisms at network level the data traffic of different cloud customers

controls.name: CS-06.2
controls.description: When implementing of infrastructure capabilities, the secure segregation shall be ensured by physically separated networks or by strongly encrypted VLANs

controls.name: CS-07
controls.description: A map of the information system is kept up and maintained, in order to avoid administrative errors during live operation and to ensure timely recovery in the event of malfunctions.

controls.name: CS-07.1
controls.description: The CSP shall maintain up-to-date all documentation of the logical structure of the network used to provision or operate the cloud service

controls.name: CS-07.2
controls.description: The documentation shall cover, at least, how the subnets are allocated, how the network is zoned and segmented, how it connects with third-party and public networks, and the geographical locations in which the cloud customers' data are stored

controls.name: CS-07.3
controls.description: In liaison with the inventory of assets (cf. AM-01), the documentation shall include the equipment that provides security functions and the servers that host the data or provide sensitive functions.

controls.name: CS-07.4
controls.description: The CSP shall perform a full review of the network topology documentation at least once a year

controls.name: CS-08
controls.description: Software-defined networking is only used if the cloud user data is protected by appropriate measures.

controls.name: CS-08.1
controls.description: The CSP shall ensure the confidentiality of the cloud user data by suitable procedures when offering functions for software-defined networking (SDN)

controls.name: CS-08.2
controls.description: The CSP shall validate the functionality of the SDN functions before providing new SDN features to CSCs or modifying existing SDN features

controls.name: CS-08.3
controls.description: The CSP shall ensure that the configuration of networks matches network security policies regardless of the means used to create the configuration

controls.name: CS-09
controls.description: Policies are defined to protect the transmission of data against unauthorised interception, manipulation, copying, modification, redirection or destruction.

controls.name: CS-09.1
controls.description: The CSP shall document, communicate and implement policies and procedures with technical and organisational safeguards to protect the transmission of data against unauthorised interception, manipulation, copying, modification, redirection or destruction, according to ISP-02

controls.name: CS-09.2
controls.description: The policy and procedures shall include references to the classification of assets (cf. AM-05)

categories.name: Portability and Interoperability
categories.description: Enable the ability to access the cloud service via other cloud services or IT systems of the cloud customers, to obtain the stored data at the end of the contractual relationship and to securely delete it from the Cloud Service Provider

controls.name: PI-01
controls.description: Inbound and outbound interfaces to/from the cloud service are documented for access from other cloud services or IT systems.

controls.name: PI-01.1
controls.description: The cloud service shall be accessible by cloud services from other CSPs or cloud customers’ IT systems through documented inbound and outbound interfaces

metrics.name: IOInterfacesPolicy01
metrics.description: Which functionalities are defined for output interfaces?

controls.name: PI-01.2
controls.description: The interfaces shall be clearly documented for subject matter experts to understand how they can be used to retrieve the data

controls.name: PI-01.3
controls.description: Communication on these interfaces shall use standardised communication protocols that ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the transmitted information according to its protection requirements

controls.name: PI-01.4
controls.description: Communication over untrusted networks shall be encrypted according to CKM-02

controls.name: PI-01.5
controls.description: The CSP shall allow its customers to verify the interfaces provided (and their security) are adequate for its protection requirements before the start of the use of the cloud service, and each time the interfaces are changed

controls.name: PI-02
controls.description: Contractual agreements define adequate information with regard to the migration of data following the termination of the contractual relationship.

controls.name: PI-02.1
PI-02.2
controls.description: The definitions in PI-02.1 shall be based on the needs of subject matter experts of potential customers who assess the suitability of the cloud service with regard to a dependency on the CSP as well as legal and regulatory requirements

controls.name: PI-02.3
controls.description: The CSP shall identify, at least once a year, legal and regulatory requirements that may apply to these aspects and adjust the contractual agreements accordingly

controls.name: PI-03
controls.description: Inbound and outbound interfaces to/from the cloud service are documented for access from other cloud services or IT systems.

controls.name: PI-03.1
controls.description: The CSP shall implement procedures for deleting its customers' data upon termination of their contract in compliance with the contractual agreements between them

controls.name: PI-03.2
controls.description: The CSC's data deletion shall include metadata and data stored in the data backups as well

controls.name: PI-03.3
controls.description: The cloud customer's data deletion procedures shall prevent recovery by forensic means

controls.name: PI-03.4
controls.description: The CSP shall document the deletion of the customer’s data, including metadata and data stored in the data backups, in a way allowing the cloud customer to track the deletion of its data

controls.name: PI-03.5
controls.description: At the end of the contract, the CSP shall delete the technical data concerning the client

categories.name: Change and Configuration Management
categories.description: Ensure that changes and configuration actions to information systems guarantee the security of the delivered cloud service

controls.name: CCM-01
controls.description: Policies and procedures are defined to control changes to information systems.

controls.name: CCM-01.1
controls.description: The CSP shall document, implement, and communicate policies and procedures for change management of the IT systems supporting the cloud service according to ISP-02

metrics.name: ChangeManagementPolicy01
metrics.description: Which change management policies need to be reviewed by cloud customers?
metrics.category: Organisational Metrics - Change and configuration management

controls.name: CCM-01.2
CCM-02
controls.description: Responsibilities are assigned inside the CSP organisation to ensure that sufficient resources can be assigned to define and execute the business continuity plan and that business continuity-related activities are supported.

controls.name: CCM-02.1
controls.description: The CSP shall categorize and prioritize changes considering the potential security effects on the system components concerned

controls.name: CCM-02.2
controls.description: The CSP shall base the decision on classification and prioritization on a risk assessment performed in accordance with RM-01 with regard to potential effects on the system components concerned

controls.name: CCM-02.3
controls.description: If the risk associated to a planned change is high, then appropriate mitigation measures shall be taken before deploying the service

controls.name: CCM-02.4
controls.description: In accordance with contractual agreements, the CSP shall submit to authorised bodies of the CSC meaningful information about the occasion, time, duration, type and scope of the change so that they can carry out their own risk assessment before the change is made available in the production environment

controls.name: CCM-02.5
controls.description: Regardless of contractual agreements, the CSP shall inform the CSC as mentioned in CCM-02.3 for changes that have the highest risk category based on their risk assessment

controls.name: CCM-03
controls.description: Changes to the cloud services are tested before deployment to minimize the risks of failure upon implementation.

controls.name: CCM-03.1
controls.description: The CSP shall test proposed changes before deployment

controls.name: CCM-03.2
controls.description: The type and scope of the tests shall correspond to the risk assessment

controls.name: CCM-03.3
controls.description: The tests shall be carried out by appropriately qualified employees or by automated test procedures that comply with the state-of-the-art

controls.name: CCM-03.4
controls.description: In accordance with contractual requirements, the CSP shall involve CSCs into the tests.

controls.name: CCM-03.5
controls.description: The CSP shall first obtain approval from CSC and anonymise customer data before using it for tests, and shall guarantee the confidentiality of the data during the whole process

controls.name: CCM-03.6
controls.description: The CSP shall determine the severity of the errors and vulnerabilities identified in the tests that are relevant for the deployment decision according to defined criteria, and shall initiate actions for timely remediation or mitigation

controls.name: CCM-03.7
controls.description: The tests performed on a change before its deployment shall include tests on the service performed on a pre-production environment

controls.name: CCM-03.8
controls.description: The CSP shall document and implement a procedure that ensures the integrity of the test data used in pre-production

controls.name: CCM-03.9
controls.description: Before deploying changes on a system component, the CSP shall perform regression testing on other components of the cloud service that depend on that system component to verify the absence of undesirable effects

controls.name: CCM-03.10
controls.description: The CSP shall automatically monitor the definition and execution of the tests relative to a change, as well as the remediation or mitigation of issues

controls.name: CCM-04
controls.description: Changes to the cloud services are approved before being deployed in the production environment.

controls.name: CCM-04.1
controls.description: The CSP shall approve any change to the cloud service, based on defined criteria, before they are made available to CSCs in the production environment

controls.name: CCM-04.2
controls.description: The CSP shall involve CSCs in the approval process according to contractual requirements

controls.name: CCM-04.3
controls.description: The CSP shall automatically monitor the approvals of changes deployed in the production environment to guarantee fulfilment of CCM-04.1

controls.name: CCM-05
controls.description: Changes to the cloud services are performed through authorized accounts and traceable to the person or system component who initiated them.

controls.name: CCM-05.1
controls.description: The CSP shall define roles and rights according to IAM-01 for the authorised personnel or system components who are allowed to make changes to the cloud service in the production environment.

controls.name: CCM-05.2
controls.description: All changes to the cloud service in the production environment shall be logged and shall be traceable back to the individual or system component that initiated the change

controls.name: CCM-05.3
controls.description: The CSP shall automatically monitor changes in the production environment to guarantee fulfilment of CCM-05.1

controls.name: CCM-06
controls.description: Version control is used to track individual changes and enable restoration of a previous version if required.

controls.name: CCM-06.1
controls.description: The CSP shall implement version control procedures to track the dependencies of individual changes and to restore affected system components back to their previous state as a result of errors or identified vulnerabilities.

controls.name: CCM-06.2
controls.description: The version control procedures shall provide appropriate safeguards to ensure that the confidentiality, integrity and availability of cloud customer data is not compromised when system components are restored back to their previous state

controls.name: CCM-06.3
controls.description: The CSP shall retain a history of the software versions and of the systems that are implemented in order to be able to reconstitute, where applicable in a test environment, a complete environment such as was implemented on a given date; the retention time for this history shall be at least the same as that for backups (cf. OPS-06)

categories.name: Development of Information Systems
categories.description: Ensure information security in the development cycle of information systems

controls.name: DEV-01
controls.description: Policies are defined to define technical and organisational measures for the development of the cloud service throughout its lifecycle

controls.name: DEV-01.1
controls.description: The CSP shall document, communicate and implement policies and procedures according to ISP-02 with technical and organisational measures for the secure development of the cloud service.

controls.name: DEV-01.2
controls.description: The policies and procedures for secure development shall consider information security from the earliest phases of design

controls.name: DEV-01.3
DEV-01.4
controls.description: The policies and procedures for development shall include measures for the enforcement of specified standards and guidelines, including automated tools

controls.name: DEV-02
controls.description: The supply chain of system components is considered in development security.

controls.name: DEV-02.1
controls.description: The CSP shall maintain a list of dependencies to hardware and software products used in the development of its cloud service

controls.name: DEV-02.2
controls.description: The CSP shall document and implement policies for the use of third-party and open source software

controls.name: DEV-02.3
controls.description: The CSP makes its list of dependencies available to customers upon request

controls.name: DEV-02.4
controls.description: In procurement for the development of the cloud service, the CSP shall perform a risk assessment in accordance to RM-01 for every product

controls.name: DEV-03
controls.description: The development environment takes information security in consideration.

controls.name: DEV-03.1
controls.description: The CSP shall ensure that the confidentiality and integrity of the source code is adequately protected at all stages of development

controls.name: DEV-03.2
controls.description: The CSP shall use version control to keep a history of the changes in source code with an attribution of changes to individual developers

controls.name: DEV-03.3
controls.description: The CSP shall implement a secure development and test environments that makes it possible to manage the entire development cycle of the information system of the cloud service

controls.name: DEV-03.4
controls.description: The CSP shall consider the development and test environments when performing risk assessment

controls.name: DEV-03.5
controls.description: The CSP shall include development resources as part of the backup policy

controls.name: DEV-04
controls.description: The development environment takes information security in consideration.

controls.name: DEV-04.1
controls.description: The CSP shall ensure that production environments are physically or logically separated from development, test or pre-production environments

controls.name: DEV-04.2
controls.description: Data contained in the production environments shall not be used in development, test or pre- production environments in order not to compromise their confidentiality

controls.name: DEV-04.3
controls.description: When non-production environments are exposed through public networks, security requirements shall be equivalent to those defined for production environment

controls.name: DEV-05
controls.description: The development environment takes information security in consideration.

controls.name: DEV-05.1
controls.description: The CSP shall document, communicate, make available and implement specific procedures for the development of functions that implement technical mechanisms or safeguards required by the EUCS scheme, with increased testing requirements.

controls.name: DEV-05.2
controls.description: Design documentation for security features shall include a specification of expected inputs, outputs and possible errors, as well as a security analysis of the adequacy and planned effectiveness of the feature

controls.name: DEV-05.3
controls.description: The tests of the security features shall cover all the specified inputs and all specified outcomes, including all specified error conditions.

controls.name: DEV-05.4
controls.description: The documentation of the tests for security features shall include at least a description of the test, the initial conditions, the expected outcome and instructions for running the test.

controls.name: DEV-05.5
controls.description: The documentation of the tests shall include a demonstration of the coverage of the source code, including branch coverage for security-critical code.

controls.name: DEV-06
controls.description: Appropriate measures are taken to identify vulnerabilities introduced in the cloud service during the development process.

controls.name: DEV-06.1
controls.description: The CSP shall apply appropriate measures to check the cloud service for vulnerabilities that may have been integrated into the cloud service during the development process.

controls.name: DEV-06.2
controls.description: The procedures for identifying vulnerabilities shall be integrated in the development process.

controls.name: DEV-06.3
DEV-06.4
controls.description: Code reviews shall be regularly performed by qualified personnel or contractors

controls.name: DEV-06.5
controls.description: The CSP shall assess the severity of identified vulnerabilities according to the criteria defined in OPS-17 and measures are taken to immediately eliminate or mitigate them.

controls.name: DEV-06.6
controls.description: The procedures for identifying such vulnerabilities also shall include annual code reviews and security penetration tests by subject matter experts, as part of the annual programme defined in OPS-19

controls.name: DEV-07
controls.description: Outsourced developments provide similar security guarantees than in-house developments.

controls.name: DEV-07.1
controls.description:
When outsourcing development of the cloud service or components thereof to a contractor, the CSP and the contractor shall contractually agree on specifications regarding at least the following aspects:
- Security in software development (requirements, design, implementation, tests and verifications) in accordance with recognised standards and methods;
- Acceptance testing of the quality of the services provided in accordance with the agreed functional and non-functional requirements; and
- Providing evidence that sufficient verifications have been carried out to rule out the existence of known vulnerabilities.

controls.name: DEV-07.2
controls.description:
Before subcontracting the development of the cloud service or components thereof, the CSP shall conduct a risk assessment according to RM-01 that considers at least the following aspects
- Management of source code by the subcontractor;
- Human resource procedures implemented by the subcontractor; and
- Required access to the CSP’s development, testing and pre-production environments.

controls.name: DEV-07.3
controls.description: The CSP shall document and implement a procedure that makes it possible to supervise and control the outsourced development activity, in order to ensure that the outsourced development activity is compliant with the secure development policy of the service provider and makes it possible to achieve a level of security of the external development that is equivalent to that of internal development

controls.name: DEV-07.4
controls.description: Internal or external employees of the CSP shall run the tests that are relevant for the deployment decision when a change includes the result of outsourced development.

categories.name: Procurement Management
categories.description: Ensure the protection of information that suppliers of the CSP can access and monitor the agreed services and security requirements

controls.description: Responsibilities are assigned inside the CSP organisation to ensure that sufficient resources can be assigned to define and execute the business continuity plan and that business continuity-related activities are supported.

controls.description: The CSP shall document, communicate and implement policies and procedures according to ISP-02 for controlling and monitoring third parties whose products or services contribute to the provision of the cloud service:

controls.name: PM-01.2
PM-01.3
controls.description: The CSP shall contractually require its subservice organizations to provide regular reports by independent auditors on the suitability of the design and operating effectiveness of their service-related internal control system with respect to the EUCS requirements.

controls.name: PM-01.4
controls.description: The reports shall include the complementary subservice organisation controls that are required, together with the controls of the Cloud Service Provider, to meet the applicable EUCS requirements with reasonable assurance

controls.name: PM-01.5
controls.description: In case the supplier organizations are not able to provide an EUCS compliance report, the CSP shall reserve the right to audit them to assess the suitability and effectiveness of the service-related internal and complementary controls by qualified personnel

controls.name: PM-02
controls.description: Suppliers of the CSP undergo a risk assessment to determine the security needs related to the product or service they provide.

controls.description: The CSP shall perform a risk assessment of its suppliers in accordance with the policies and procedures for the control and monitoring of third parties before they start contributing to the provision of the cloud service:

controls.name: PM-02.2
PM-02.3
controls.description: Following the risk assessment of a subservice provider, the CSP shall define for every applicable EUCS requirement a list of Complementary Subservice Organization Controls (CSOC) to be implemented by the subservice provider

controls.name: PM-02.4
controls.description: The CSP shall ensure that the subservice provider has implemented the CSOCs, and that the subservice provider has made available evidence supporting the assessment of their effectiveness to the targeted evaluation level

controls.name: PM-02.5
controls.description: The adequacy of the risk assessment and of the definition of CSOCs shall be reviewed regularly, at least annually

controls.name: PM-03
controls.description: A centralized directory of suppliers is available to facilitate their control and monitoring.

controls.name: PM-03.1
controls.description: The CSP shall maintain a directory for controlling and monitoring the suppliers who contribute to the delivery of the cloud service

controls.name: PM-03.2
PM-03.3
controls.description: The CSP shall verify the directory for completeness, accuracy and validity at least annually

controls.name: PM-04
controls.description: Monitoring mechanisms are in place to ensure that third parties comply with their regulatory and con obligations.

controls.name: PM-04.1
controls.description: The CSP shall monitor the compliance of its suppliers with information security requirements and applicable legal and regulatory requirements in accordance with policies and procedures concerning controlling and monitoring of third-parties

controls.name: PM-04.2
PM-04.3
controls.description: The frequency of the monitoring shall correspond to the classification of the third party based on the risk assessment conducted by the Cloud Service Provider (cf. PM-02), and the results of the monitoring shall be included in the review of the third party's risk assessment.

controls.name: PM-04.4
controls.description: Identified violations and deviations shall be analysed, evaluated and treated in accordance with the risk management procedure (cf. RM-01)

controls.name: PM-04.5
controls.description: When a change in a third-party contributing to the delivery of the cloud service affects its level of security, the CSP shall inform all of its CSCs without delay

controls.name: PM-04.6
controls.description: The CSP shall document and implement a procedure to review and update, at least once a year, non-disclosure or confidentiality requirements regarding suppliers contributing to the delivery of the service

controls.name: PM-04.7
PM-04.8
controls.description: The CSP shall automatically monitor Identified violations and discrepancies, and these shall be automatically reported to the responsible personnel or system components of the Cloud Service Provider for prompt assessment and action

controls.name: PM-05
controls.description: Strategies are documented that ensure minimum business disruption if the relationship with a supplier is terminated.

controls.description: The CSP shall define exit strategies for the purchase of services where the risk assessment of the suppliers identified a very high dependency

controls.name: PM-05.2

controls.description: A policy is defined to respond to security incidents in a fast, efficient and orderly manner.
