controls.description: The CSP shall document, communicate and implement policies and procedures according to ISP-02 containing technical and organisational safeguards to ensure a fast, effective and proper response to all known security incidents:

controls.name: IM-01.2
controls.description: The policies and procedures shall include guidelines for the classification, prioritization, and escalation of security incidents and creates interfaces for incident management and business continuity management

controls.name: IM-01.3
controls.description: The CSP shall establish a Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT), which contributes to the coordinated resolution of security incidents

metrics.name: IncidentManagementPolicy01
metrics.description: Which team is in charge of handling security incidents?

controls.name: IM-01.4
controls.description: The CSP shall inform the customers affected by security incidents in a timely and appropriate manner

controls.name: IM-01.5
controls.description: The incident management policy shall include procedures as to how the data of a suspicious system can be collected in a conclusive manner in the event of a security incident

controls.name: IM-01.6
controls.description: The incident management policy shall include analysis plans for typical security incidents

controls.name: IM-01.7
controls.description: The incident management policy shall include an evaluation methodology so that the collected information does not lose its evidential value in any subsequent legal assessment

controls.name: IM-01.8
controls.description: The incident management policy shall include provisions for the regular testing of the incident response capabilities to determine the overall effectiveness of the capabilities and to identify potential deficiencies

metrics.name: IncidentManagementPolicy8
metrics.description: How often must the Incident Management plan be tested?

controls.name: IM-02
controls.description: A methodology is defined and applied to process security incidents in a fast, efficient and orderly manner.

controls.name: IM-02.1
controls.description: The CSP shall classify, prioritize, and perform root-cause analyses for events that could constitute a security incident, using their subject matter experts and external security providers where appropriate

metrics.name: IncidentManagementPolicy09
metrics.description: How are sources of information considered for identifying incidents?

metrics.name: IncidentManagementPolicy10
metrics.description: Which process is in place to analyze a potential incident?

controls.name: IM-02.2
controls.description: The CSP shall maintain a catalogue that clearly identifies the security incidents that affect customer data, and use that catalogue to classify incidents

controls.name: IM-02.3
controls.description: The incident classification mechanism shall include provisions to correlate events. In addition, these correlated events shall themselves be assessed and classified according to their criticality

controls.name: IM-02.4
controls.description: The CSP shall simulate the identification, analysis, and defence of security incidents and attacks at least once a year through appropriate tests and exercises

controls.name: IM-02.5
controls.description: The CSP shall monitor the processing of incident to verify the application of incident management policies and procedures

controls.name: IM-03
controls.description: Security incidents are documented to and reported in a timely manner to customers.

controls.name: IM-03.1
controls.description: The CSP shall document the implemented measures after a security incident has been processed and, following the contractual agreements, the document shall be sent to the affected customers for final acknowledgment or, if applicable, as confirmation.

controls.name: IM-03.2
controls.description: The CSP shall make information on security incidents or confirmed security breaches available to all affected customers

controls.name: IM-03.3
controls.description: The CSP shall continuously report on security incidents to affected customers until the security incident is closed and a solution is applied and documented, in accordance to the defined SLA and contractual agreements

controls.name: IM-03.4
controls.description: The CSP shall allow customers to actively approve the solution before automatically approving it after a certain period

controls.name: IM-04
controls.description: Security incidents are documented to and reported in a timely manner to customers.

controls.name: IM-04.1
controls.description: The CSP shall inform employees and external business partners of their contractual obligations to report all security events that become known to them and are directly related to the cloud service

metrics.name: IncidentManagementPolicy6
metrics.description: When must staff report potential security and privacy issues?

controls.name: IM-04.2
controls.description: The CSP shall not take any negative action against those who communicate "false reports" of events that do not subsequently turn out to be incidents, and shall make that policy known as part of its communication to employees and external business partners

controls.name: IM-04.3
controls.description: The CSP shall define, make public and implement a single point of contact to report security events and vulnerabilities

metrics.name: IncidentManagementPolicy5
metrics.description: To whom must staff report potential security and privacy issues?

metrics.name: IncidentManagementPolicy02
metrics.description: Which approach is used for reporting incidents to the CSP?

controls.name: IM-05
controls.description: Customers are kept regularly informed of the status incidents that concern them.

controls.name: IM-05.1
controls.description: The CSP shall periodically inform its customers on the status of the incidents affecting the CSC, or, where appropriate and necessary, involve them in the resolution, according to the contractual agreements

metrics.name: IncidentManagementPolicy11
metrics.description: Which policy is defined to guarantee user involvement for incident management?

controls.name: IM-05.2
controls.description: As soon as an incident has been closed, The CSP shall inform its customers about the actions taken, according to the contractual agreements

metrics.name: IncidentManagementPolicy12
metrics.description: When are users notified of relevant incidents?

controls.name: IM-06
controls.description: Measures are in place to continuously improve the service from experience learned in incidents

controls.name: IM-06.1
controls.description: The CSP shall perform an analysis of security incidents to identify recurrent or significant incidents and to identify the need for further protection, if needed with the support of external bodies

controls.name: IM-06.2
controls.description: The CSP shall only contract supporting external bodies that are qualified incident response service providers or government agencies

controls.name: IM-06.3
controls.description: The CSP shall define, implement and maintain a knowledge repository of security incidents and the measures taken to solve them, as well as information related to the assets that these incidents affected, and use that information to enrich the classification catalogue

controls.name: IM-06.4
controls.description: The intelligence gained from the incident management and gathered in the knowledge repository shall be used to identify recurring incidents or potential significant incidents and to determine the need for advanced safeguards and implement them

controls.name: IM-07
controls.description: Measures are in place to preserve information related to security incidents.

controls.name: IM-07.1
controls.description: The CSP shall document and implement a procedure to archive all documents and evidence that provide details on security incidents

metrics.name: IncidentManagementPolicy03
metrics.description: Which entity maintains the evidence related to cyberincidents?

controls.name: IM-07.2
controls.description: The documents and evidence shall be archived in a way that could be used as evidence in court

controls.name: IM-07.3
controls.description: When the CSP requires additional expertise in order to preserve the evidences and secure the chain of custody on a security incident, the CSP shall contract a qualified incident response service provider only

controls.name: IM-07.4
controls.description: The CSP shall implement security mechanisms and processes for protecting all the information related to security incidents in accordance with criticality levels and legal requirements in effect

controls.name: IM-07.5
controls.description: The service provider shall establish an integrated team of forensic/incident responder personnel specifically trained on evidence preservation and chain of custody management

metrics.name: IncidentManagementPolicy13
metrics.description: Which entity coordinates the forensic investigation?

categories.name: Business Continuity
categories.description: Plan, implement, maintain and test procedures and measures for business continuity and emergency management

controls.name: BC-01
controls.description: Responsibilities are assigned inside the CSP organisation to ensure that sufficient resources can be assigned to define and execute the business continuity plan and that business continuity-related activities are supported.

controls.name: BC-01.1
controls.description: The CSP shall document, communicate and make available policies and procedures establishing the strategy and guidelines to ensure business continuity and contingency management

metrics.name: BusinessContinuityPolicy01
metrics.description: Which policies are defined for business continuity?

controls.name: BC-01.2
controls.description: The CSP shall name (a member of) top management as the process owner of business continuity and emergency management, and responsible for establishing the process within the company following the strategy as well as ensuring compliance with the guidelines, and for ensuring that sufficient resources are made available for an effective process

controls.name: BC-01.3
controls.description: The business continuity and contingency management process owner shall ensure that sufficient resources are made available for an effective process

controls.name: BC-02
controls.description: Business continuity policies and procedures cover the determination of the impact of any malfunction or interruption to the cloud service or enterprise.

controls.name: BC-02.1
controls.description: The policies and procedures for business continuity and contingency management shall include the need to perform a business impact analysis to determine the impact of any malfunction to the cloud service or enterprise.

controls.name: BC-02.2

metrics.name: BusinessContinuityPolicy02
metrics.description: For which risks are defined business continuity plans?

controls.name: BC-02.3
controls.description: The business impact analysis resulting from these policies and procedures shall be reviewed at regular intervals, at least once a year, or after significant organisational or environment- related changes.

controls.name: BC-03
controls.description: A business continuity framework including a business continuity plan and associated contingency plans is available.

controls.name: BC-03.1
controls.description: The CSP shall document and implement a business continuity plan and contingency plans to ensure continuity of the services, taking into account information security constraints and the results of the business impact analysis

controls.name: BC-03.2
controls.description: The business continuity plan and contingency plans shall be based on industry-accepted standards and shall document which standards are being used

controls.name: BC-03.3

metrics.name: BusinessContinuityPolicy03
metrics.description: Which aspects and measures are covered by the business continuity plan?

controls.name: BC-03.4
controls.description: The business continuity plan shall be reviewed at regular intervals, at least once a year, or after significant organisational or environment-related changes.

controls.name: BC-04
controls.description: The business continuity framework is tested on a regular basis.

controls.name: BC-04.1
controls.description: The business impact analysis, business continuity plan and contingency plans shall be tested at regular intervals (at least once a year) or after an update

controls.name: BC-04.2
controls.description: The tests shall be documented and the results considered to update the business continuity plan and to define future operational continuity measures

controls.name: BC-04.3
controls.description: The tests shall involve CSCs and relevant third parties, such as external service providers and suppliers

controls.name: BC-04.4
controls.description: In addition to the tests, exercises shall also be carried out, which are, among other things, based on scenarios resulting from security incidents that have already occurred in the past

categories.name: Compliance
categories.description: Avoid non-compliance with legal, regulatory, self-imposed or contractual information security and compliance requirements

controls.name: CO-01
controls.description: The legal, regulatory, self-imposed and contractual requirements relevant to the information security of the cloud service are defined and documented.

controls.name: CO-01.1
controls.description: The CSP shall document the legal, regulatory, self-imposed and contractual requirements relevant to the information security of the cloud service

metrics.name: CompliancePolicy01
metrics.description: How are compliance requirements elicited?

controls.name: CO-01.2
controls.description: The CSP shall document and implement procedures for complying to these contractual requirements

controls.name: CO-01.3
controls.description: The CSP shall provide these procedures when requested by a CSC

controls.name: CO-01.4
controls.description: The CSP shall document and implement an active monitoring of the legal, regulatory and contractual requirements that affect the service

metrics.name: CompliancePolicy02
metrics.description: Which mechanisms are implemented to periodically monitor compliance requirements?

metrics.name: CompliancePolicy03
metrics.description: Which additional certifications are in scope of the compliance requirements?

controls.name: CO-02
controls.description: Conditions are defined that allow audits to be conducted in a way that facilitates the gathering of evidence while minimizing interference with the delivery of the cloud service.

controls.name: CO-02.1
controls.description:
The CSP shall document, communicate, make available and implement policies and procedures for planning and conducting audits, made in accordance with ISP-02 and addressing at least the following aspects:
- Restriction to read-only access to system components in accordance with the agreed audit plan and as necessary to perform the activities;
- Activities that may result in malfunctions to the cloud service or breaches of contractual requirements are performed during scheduled maintenance windows or outside peak periods; and
- Logging and monitoring of activities

controls.name: CO-02.2
controls.description: The CSP shall document and implement an audit programme over three years that defines the scope and the frequency of the audits in accordance with the management of change, policies, and the results of the risk assessment

controls.name: CO-02.3
controls.description: The CSP shall grant its CSCs contractually guaranteed information and define their audit rights

metrics.name: CompliancePolicy04
metrics.description: Which audit rights are defined for customers?

controls.name: CO-03
controls.description: Subject matter experts regularly check the compliance of the Information Security Management System (ISMS) to relevant and applicable legal, regulatory, self-imposed or contractual requirements.

controls.name: CO-03.1
controls.description: The CSP shall perform at regular intervals and at least annually internal audits by subject matter experts to check the compliance of their internal security control system to the requirements defined in CO-01.

controls.name: CO-03.2
controls.description: The internal audit shall check the compliance with the requirements of the scheme at the targeted EUCS assurance level.

controls.name: CO-03.3
controls.description: Identified vulnerabilities and deviations shall be subject to risk assessment in accordance with the risk management procedure (cf. RM-01) and follow-up measures are defined and tracked (cf. OPS-17).

controls.name: CO-03.4
controls.description: Internal audits shall be supplemented by procedures to automatically monitor compliance with applicable requirements of policies and instructions

controls.name: CO-03.5
controls.description: The CSP shall implement automated monitoring to identify vulnerabilities and deviations, which shall be automatically reported to the appropriate CSP’s subject matter experts for immediate assessment and action

controls.name: CO-03.6
controls.description: The CSP shall document specifically deviations that are nonconformities from the EUCS requirements, including an assessment of their severity, and keep track of their remediation

controls.name: CO-03.7
controls.description: The CSP shall inform CSCs who operate an EUCS-certified cloud service of nonconformities relatively to EUCS requirements

controls.name: CO-04
controls.description: The top management of the CSP is kept informed of the performance of the internal control system in order to ensure its continued suitability, adequacy and effectiveness

controls.name: CO-04.1
controls.description: The CSP shall regular inform its top management about the information security performance within the scope of the internal control system.

controls.name: CO-04.2
controls.description: This information shall be included in the management review of the internal control system that is performed at least once a year

categories.name: User Documentation
categories.description: Provides up-to-date information on the secure configuration and known vulnerabilities of the cloud service for cloud customers

controls.name: DOC-01
controls.description: Provide information to assist the cloud customer in the secure configuration, installation and use of the cloud service.

controls.name: DOC-01.1
controls.description: The CSP shall make publicly available guidelines and recommendations to assist CSCs with the secure configuration, installation, deployment, operation and maintenance of the cloud service provided

metrics.name: GuidelinesCloudCustomersQ1
metrics.description: Which customer guidelines are defined for password management?

metrics.name: GuidelinesCloudCustomersQ2
metrics.description: Which customer guidelines are defined for identity management?

metrics.name: GuidelinesCloudCustomersQ3
metrics.description: Which customer guidelines are defined for asset management?

controls.name: DOC-01.2

metrics.name: RecommendationCustomer01
metrics.description: Which aspects are covered in the security recommendations for customers?

controls.name: DOC-01.3
controls.description: The CSP shall maintain guidelines and recommendations applicable to the cloud service in the version intended for productive use

controls.name: DOC-01.4
controls.description: The CSP shall describe in the user documentation all risks shared with the customer

controls.name: DOC-01.5
controls.description: The CSP shall regularly analyse how the CSCs apply the security recommendations and CCCs, and take measure to encourage compliance based on the defined shared responsibility model

controls.name: DOC-02
controls.description: Provide information to assist the cloud customer in the secure configuration, installation and use of the cloud service.

controls.name: DOC-02.1
controls.description: The CSP shall operate or refer to a publicly available and daily updated online register of known vulnerabilities that affect the provided cloud service

controls.name: DOC-02.2
controls.description: The online register of vulnerabilities shall also include known vulnerabilities that affect assets provided by the CSP that the cloud customers have to install, provide or operate themselves under the customers responsibility

controls.name: DOC-02.3
controls.description: The presentation of the vulnerabilities shall follow an industry-accepted scoring system for the description of vulnerabilities

controls.name: DOC-02.4
controls.description: The information contained in the online register shall include sufficient information to form a suitable basis for risk assessment and possible follow-up measures on the part of cloud users

controls.name: DOC-02.5
controls.description: For each vulnerability, the online register shall indicate whether software updates are available, when they will be rolled out and whether they will be deployed by the CSP, the CSC or both

controls.name: DOC-03
controls.description: Provide transparent information about the location of the data and of its processing.

controls.name: DOC-03.1
controls.description:
The CSP shall provide comprehensible and transparent information on:
- Its jurisdiction; and
- System component locations, including its subcontractors, where the cloud customer's data is processed, stored and backed up.

metrics.name: DataLocationPolicy01
metrics.description: Which data location regions are defined for compliance?

controls.name: DOC-03.2
controls.description: The CSP shall provide sufficient information for subject matter experts of the CSC to determine to assess the suitability of the cloud service’s jurisdiction and locations from a legal and regulatory perspective

controls.name: DOC-03.3
DOC-03.4
controls.description: The CSP shall document the locations from which it conducts support operations for clients, and it shall document the list of operations that can be carried by client support in each location

controls.name: DOC-04
controls.description: Provide a rationale for the assurance level target by the cloud service.

controls.name: DOC-04.1
controls.description: The CSP shall provide a justification for the assurance level targeted in the certification, based on the risks associated to the cloud service’s targeted users and use cases

controls.name: DOC-04.2
controls.description: If the CSP claims compliance to security profiles for its cloud service, the justification shall cover the security profiles.

controls.name: DOC-04.3
controls.description: A summary of the justification shall be made publicly available as part of the certification package, which shall allow CSCs to perform a high-level analysis about their own use cases

controls.name: DOC-04.4
controls.description: The justification shall be based on a risk analysis according to RM-01

controls.name: DOC-05
controls.description: Provide the information required by customers that want to use the cloud service as a base service f certified cloud service.

controls.name: DOC-05.1
controls.description: If the CSP expects CSCs to certify with EUCS their own services based on its cloud service using composition, it shall provide specific documentation for them, based on the Complementary Customer Controls (CCCs) that they have defined

controls.name: DOC-05.2
controls.description: The CSP shall include in the description provided for each CCC a list of actionable requirements for the CSC, and it shall associate each CCC to an EUCS requirement

controls.name: DOC-05.3
controls.description: The CSP shall make the documentation defined in DOC-05.1 available to cloud customers upon request

controls.name: DOC-05.4
controls.description: The CSP shall label each requirement associated to a CCC with the lowest EUCS assurance level for which it is required

controls.name: DOC-06
controls.description: Provide the information required by customers that want to use the CSP as subservice organization for the cloud service

controls.name: DOC-06.1
controls.description: If the CSP expects CSCs to certify with EUCS their own services based on its cloud service using composition, it shall document for each EUCS requirement how its cloud service will contribute (if any) to the fulfilment of the requirement by the cloud service developed by the CSC using the CSP as subservice organization.

controls.name: DOC-06.2
controls.description: The CSP shall make the documentation defined in DOC-06.1 available to cloud customers upon request

controls.name: DOC-06.3
controls.description: The CSP shall justify the contributions in a companion document

controls.description: The CSP shall subject investigation requests from government agencies to a legal assessment by subject matter experts

categories.name: Product Safety and Security
categories.description: Provide appropriate mechanisms for cloud customers

controls.name: PSS-01
controls.description: Cloud customers have access to sufficient information about the cloud service through error handling and logging mechanisms.

controls.name: PSS-01.1
controls.description: The CSP shall offer to their CSCs error handling and logging mechanisms that allow them to obtain security-related information about the security status of the cloud service as well as the data, services or functions it provides

controls.name: PSS-01.2
controls.description:
The information provided shall be detailed enough to allow cloud users to check the following aspects, insofar as they are applicable to the cloud service:
- Which data, services or functions available to the cloud user within the cloud service, have been accessed by whom and when (Audit Logs);
- Malfunctions during processing of automatic or manual actions; and
- Changes to security-relevant configuration parameters, error handling and logging mechanisms, user authentication, action authorisation, cryptography, and communication security.

controls.name: PSS-01.3
controls.description: The logged information shall be protected from unauthorised access and modification and can be deleted by the CSC

controls.name: PSS-01.4
controls.description: When the CSC is responsible for the activation or type and scope of logging, the CSP shall provide appropriate logging capabilities

controls.name: PSS-01.5
controls.description: The CSP shall make the information available to CSCs via documented interfaces that are suitable for further processing this information as part of their Security Information and Event Management (SIEM).

controls.name: PSS-02
controls.description: A suitable session management is used to protect confidentiality, availability, integrity and authenticity during interactions with the cloud service.

controls.name: PSS-02.1
controls.description: A suitable session management system shall be used that at least corresponds to the state- of-the-art and is protected against known attacks

controls.name: PSS-02.2
controls.description: The session management system shall include mechanisms that invalidate a session after it has been detected as inactive.

controls.name: PSS-02.3
controls.description: If inactivity is detected by time measurement, the time interval shall be configurable by the CSP or - if technically possible - by the CSC

controls.name: PSS-03
controls.description: Software-defined networking is only used if the cloud user data is protected by appropriate measures

controls.name: PSS-03.1
controls.description: The CSP shall ensure the confidentiality of the cloud user data by suitable procedures when offering functions for software-defined networking (SDN)

controls.name: PSS-03.2
controls.description: The CSP shall validate the functionality of the SDN functions before providing new SDN features to CSCs or modifying existing SDN features

controls.name: PSS-03.3
controls.description: The CSP shall ensure that the configuration of networks matches network security policies regardless of the means used to create the configuration

controls.name: PSS-04
controls.description: Services for providing and managing virtual machines and containers to customers include appropriate protection measures.

controls.name: PSS-04.1
controls.description:
The CSP shall ensure the following aspects if CSCs operate virtual machines or containers with the cloud service:
- The CSC can restrict the selection of images of virtual machines or containers according to his specifications, so that users of this CSC can only launch the images or containers released according to these restrictions.
- In addition, these images provided by the CSP are hardened according to generally accepted industry standards.

controls.name: PSS-04.2
controls.description:
The CSP shall ensure the following aspects if CSCs operate virtual machines or containers with the cloud service:
- If the CSP provides images of virtual machines or containers to the CSC, the CSP appropriately inform the CSC of the changes made to the previous version

controls.name: PSS-04.3
controls.description: An integrity check shall be performed and automatically monitored to detect image manipulations and reported to the CSC at start-up and runtime of virtual machine or container images

controls.name: PSS-05
controls.description: Provide users with choices about the location of the data and of its processing.

controls.name: PSS-05.1
controls.description: The CSP shall allow the CSC to specify the locations (location/country) of the data processing and storage including data backups according to the contractually available options

controls.name: PSS-05.2
controls.description: All CSP commitments regarding locations of data processing and storage shall be enforced by the cloud service architecture
